description:
A person bowing deeply which is known as dogeza in Japan. Used to express a sincere apology, or to request a large favour.

Many variations of this emoji are misinterpreted as a person doing push-ups, lying down to have a massage, or doing a cute "head resting on hands" gesture.
apple_vendor_description: The person bowing emoji on Apple devices presents a figure in a respectful and humble posture, with their torso bent forward and head lowered in a gesture of deep deference. Appleâ€™s design imbues this emoji with smooth gradients and realistic lighting, highlighting the fabric of their attire and conveying a sense of sincere apology or gratitude. On Apple devices, this emoji elegantly communicates profound respect, apology, or thanks, embodying a culturally significant act of reverence.
